description.narrative: To provide a reliable population Estimate for Somalia in support of evidence based decisions and policy.

UNFPA har inkommit med en ansökan om SEK 3 608 470 för stöd till projektet “Post PESS and Thematic Analysis for Statistics in Somalia” under perioden 2015-2016. Detta är en direkt fortsättning av Sidas stöd till den befolkningsuppskattning (Population Estimation Survey, PESS) som genfomfördes under 2013-2014.
Som en fortsättning av den framgångsrikt genomförda befolkningsuppskattningen i Somalia syftar denna fas till att; 1) genomföra ytterligare analyser av den insamlade informationen för att generera tematiska rapporter, 2) Sprida information om PESS-rapporten 3) Stärka planeringsministeriets kapacitet och 4) Design av en webbaserad databas för att lagra och sprida statistiken. Projektet kommer att genomföras tillsammans med planeringsministerierna i Somaliland, Puntland och på federal nivå.
Projektets budget uppgår till SEK 3 608 470, vilket kommer att finansieras till fullo av Sverige.

UNFPA has applied to Sida for funding of SEK 3 608 470 to carry out the ‘Post PESS and Thematic Analysis for Statistics in Somalia’ during the period 2015-2016. This follows a previously Sida supported ‘Population Estimation Survey for Somalia carried out from 2013-2014.
Following a successful PESS phase that provided an estimate of the Somalia population, the proposed phase aims to; 1) Undertake an in-depth analysis of the widely collected PESS data to generate thematic statistical reports, 2) Further disseminate and launch the PESS report as well as additional thematic reports; 3) Strengthen the capacity of the Ministry of Planning; and 4) Design a web-based database for storage, retrieval and dissemination of PESS data. The project will be implemented in collaboration with the Somali Ministries of Planning in Somaliland, Puntland and the Federal Government.
The intervention’s total budget is SEK 3 608 470 and Sweden will fund the whole budget.

description.narrative: The Population Estimation Survey for Somalia (PESS) was implemented to fill the scarcity of reliable and comprehensive information on population characteristics in Somalia. The Post-PESS Statistical Capacity Development for Statistics in Somalia was necessitated by the insufficient capacity of the statistical systems in Somalia to undertake a full range of common statistical functions. This is due to the existing weak statistical agencies and insufficient capacity of their human resource. The production and launch of Population Estimation Survey marked a new milestone in the history of Somalis, providing much-awaited information on population after more than four decades. It also set the foundation for the future of data collection for Somalis. The data from PESS is now useful for the formulation and analysis of policies including the design of effective strategies to support the Somali authorities and development partners. Further, the information is being used to set up targets and integrate population variables into development planning processes; as well as for implementing, monitoring and evaluation of development programmes in humanitarian setting, recovery and development assistance.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
